intro: Laphamia staurophylla, commonly known as the star-leaved lophanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the tribe Diplacaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of white or pink. Laphamia staurophylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
